sentences: Adam Alexander Carson (born February 5, 1975) is the drummer of the alternative rock band AFI.
His drumming can be found on Tiger Army's Early Years EP as well as their debut album Tiger Army.
Carson was also a member of Influence 13 – a band formed by Nick 13, Jade Puget (who joined AFI in 1998), Geoff Kresge (who left AFI in 1996), and two other friends.
Carson was also a member of Influence 13 – a band formed by Nick 13, Jade Puget (who joined AFI in 1998), Geoff Kresge (who left AFI in 1996), and two other friends.
Carson's aspirations to be a drummer in a band were realized when he was eight or nine years old.
While still in high school, Davey Havok, Mark Stopholese, and Vic Chalker formed AFI in November 1991.
I remember my dad was in the garage and spent like an hour trying to get the bass and guitar in tune.
AFI briefly split in 1993 after each of its members graduated high school and attended different colleges.
In December of that year, the band reunited and played a show for approximately 200 fans at the Phoenix Theater in Petaluma, California.
In December of that year, the band reunited and played a show for approximately 200 fans at the Phoenix Theater in Petaluma, California.
On August 3, 2013, Carson married English model Eirinie Hamil.
The couple have two daughters together, Luka Lily Carson, born on April 22, 2017 and Selah Marigold Carson, born on April 17, 2021.
The couple have two daughters together, Luka Lily Carson, born on April 22, 2017 and Selah Marigold Carson, born on April 17, 2021.
Between 1993 and 1995 AFI released several vinyl EPs (Behind the Times; Eddie Picnic's All Wet; This Is Berkeley, Not West Bay; AFI/Heckle; Bombing the Bay; Fly in the Ointment) independently.
Their first full-length, Answer That and Stay Fashionable was released August 11, 1995, on Wingnut Records, and was produced by Tim Armstrong.
Burgan went on to help AFI record Shut Your Mouth and Open Your Eyes (1997) and was invited to become the full-time bassist.
After recording the A Fire Inside EP (1998), Stopholese left the band and was replaced by Jade Puget, former member of Influence 13 and vocalist Havok's close friend.

The band then recorded Black Sails in the Sunset (1999), a musical turning point which introduced AFI fans to a much darker sound, mixing the band's original hardcore roots with dark romantic influences.

The band then recorded Black Sails in the Sunset (1999), a musical turning point which introduced AFI fans to a much darker sound, mixing the band's original hardcore roots with dark romantic influences.
The All Hallows EP (October 5, 1999) explored the horror punk genre touched upon on Black Sails, featuring artwork and lyrics containing Halloween themes.
The All Hallows EP (October 5, 1999) explored the horror punk genre touched upon on Black Sails, featuring artwork and lyrics containing Halloween themes.
The album was released on October 26, 1999.
On September 19, 2000, AFI released The Art of Drowning, which debuted on the Billboard charts at number 174, and peaked at number 9 on the Heatseekers chart.
"The Days of the Phoenix" was released as a single and video and had some moderate mainstream success, garnering the band more TV and radio airplay.
In 2002, AFI left Nitro Records.
Their first album for the label, Sing the Sorrow, was released in 2003.
They were nominated in the 2003 MTV Video Music Awards for the MTV2 award category for the "Girl's Not Grey" video, which came to be their first VMA.
In June 2006, AFI's seventh studio album, Decemberunderground, was released on Interscope Records.
AFI's eighth album, Crash Love, was released on September 29, 2009.
The first single from the album, "Medicate", was released on August 25, 2009, and reached No. 7 on the Billboard Alternative Songs Chart.
AFI's ninth studio album, Burials, was released on October 22, 2013.
The album's first single, "I Hope You Suffer" was released July 22, 2013, followed by the release of the album's second single, "17 Crimes" on August 6, 2013.
The album's first single, "I Hope You Suffer" was released July 22, 2013, followed by the release of the album's second single, "17 Crimes" on August 6, 2013.
Carson is involved in a new band called The Reckless Kind (formed in 2011), described as "A 5 piece, heavy soul band."
They recently finished recording their debut album, and have played several shows.
